concept.title: Step 2. Call the Runtime Property
concept.shortdesc: Use the runtime:conf function to call a runtime property. You can use runtime properties to represent any stage or pipeline property that allows the use of the expression language.

conbody.note: If you defined the runtime properties in the configuration file, enter just <property name> and not runtime.conf_<property name>.
conbody.p: You can use a runtime property to represent a part of a property. For example, you could use a RootDir runtime property and append the rest of the directory in the property as follows:${runtime:conf('RootDir')}/logfiles
